item.title: The Politics of Free Speech
item.description: Should Platforms Be Neutral? Facebook banned praise, support and representation of white nationalism and separatism, because the two concepts cannot be meaningfully separated from white supremacy and organized hate groups. Furthermore, people that search for related terms will have “Life After Hate” suggested to them. [] Part of me is uncomfortable. Sure, Facebook is trying to do the right thing here. What if Facebook was replaced by some tyrannical government that censors opposition?

item.title: Facebook to Pay $550 Million to Settle Facial Recognition Suit [The New York Times]
item.description: Facebook to Pay $550 Million to Settle Facial Recognition Suit. Natasha Singer; Mike Isaac. The New York Times. https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/29/technology/facebook-privacy-lawsuit-earnings.html. Jan 29, 2020. Illinois’ biometric privacy law requires companies to obtain written permission before collecting a person’s biometrics. Residents have the right to sue for up to $5,000 per violation. Facebook's Tag Suggestions harvested facial data without getting written consent nor telling Illinois users for how long the data would be kept.

item.title: The Trauma Floor: The Secret Lives of FB Moderators in America [The Verge]
item.description: The Trauma Floor: The Secret Lives of FB Moderators in America. Casey Newton. The Verge. https://www.theverge.com/2019/2/25/18229714/cognizant-facebook-content-moderator-interviews-trauma-working-conditions-arizona. Feb 25, 2019. Moderators in Phoenix will make just $28,800 per year — while the average FB employee has a total compensation of $240,000. Team leaders micro-manage content moderators’ every bathroom break. Two Muslim employees were ordered to stop praying during their 9min/day of allotted “wellness time”. Employees can be fired after making just a handful of errors a week, and those who remain live in fear of former colleagues returning to seek vengeance.

item.title: Facebook Monetizing Encrypted Messaging by Analyzing Metadata [Twitter]
item.description: Facebook Monetizing Encrypted Messaging by Analyzing Metadata. @SarahJamieLewis. https://twitter.com/SarahJamieLewis/status/1088914192847917056. Jan 25, 2019. Claim: FB will track relationships and social groups and make that information accessible to law enforcement. FB is a corporation that needs to make money; surveillance makes them money. Contention: Actual privacy and security must protect metadata as well as content. Cwtch by OpenPrivacy aims to minimize metadata exposed by apps used. It's built on Tor. Challenges: message latency, server reliability & discovery, (online) first contact problem for key exchange.

item.title: How the Chinese Govt Controls the Media [SoECS]
item.description: Seeing government influence through coordination of sensitive coverage, localization of negative news & crowding out other stories on the front page. Structural topic models (LDA + context, e.g. topic prevalence, choice of words) analyze fundamental aspect of the news that can't be changed. Instead of assuming news follows events, investigate!

item.title: Lessons Learned in Tech Policy [SoECS]
item.description: Local governments face severe constraints. Liaising with big tech for employees on sabbaticals could alleviate this. State legislators may have unfounded opinions, but they have the sway, so work with them. Rural-urban differences. Rural folk were more active. Urban folks wrote angry blogs and that was it.

item.title: The Wolf that Tried to Play Nice [SoECS]
item.description: AT&T restricted FaceTime from running on some data plans. Justifications? FaceTime is preloaded, therefore 100% of users have it FaceTime wasn't efficient in network usage. The capacity was asymmetrical, but video chat is symmetrical Interestingly enough, AT&T required Apple to greenlight it, which they did. AT&T worked with top developers to teach network etiquette.

item.title: Google's Project Dragonfly [The Intercept]
item.description: Google Plans to Launch Censored Search Engine in China, Leaked Documents Reveal [The Intercept]. Ryan Gallagher. The Intercept. https://theintercept.com/2018/08/01/google-china-search-engine-censorship/. Aug 1, 2018. Project Dragonfly A censored version of Google search that blacklists websites and search terms about human rights, democracy, religion and peaceful protests. China has 750m people; 80% of its internet access is on Android. There's $$$ to be made. Between 2006 and 2010, Google had maintained a censored Google Search, but was heavily criticized.

item.title: How the Enlightenment Ends [Henry Kissinger]
item.description: Horsemen of the End of Enlightenment Kissinger's waking call was the triumph of AlphaGo. He is wary of the self-learning machine. The printing press sparked the Age of Reason. However, a world reliant on data & algorithms, uncontrollable by ethical/philosophical norms will upend the Age of Reason. The people developing AI care more about technical feats than ethical/philosophical issues. Harbingers of the end of enlightenment: information overload diverts people from introspection, ability to target micro-groups breaks up the previous consensus on priorities.

item.title: An Apology for the Internet - How It Went Wrong [Intelligencer]
item.description: An Apology for the Internet - How It Went Wrong. Noah Kulwin. NY Mag. http://nymag.com/intelligencer/2018/04/an-apology-for-the-internet-from-the-people-who-built-it.html. Apr 16, 2018. Start with hippie good intentions. A generation embracing new technology as a tool to transform the world for good. Can Duruk: You were going to Facebook not to work but to make the world more open and connected. Mix in capitalism on steroids. To save the world, you first need to take it over.

item.title: Cambridge Analytica Uncovered: Secret filming reveals election tricks [Channel 4]
item.description: Cambridge Analytica Uncovered: Secret filming reveals election tricks. Channel 4 News. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mpbeOCKZFfQ. Mar 19, 2018. Pay people to take surveys but through an app. Mine their profile data, and also crawl their friends. Identify swayable voters and their sensitivities. Craft targeted ads. Play on (unconscious) fears and hopes. Elections are about emotions, not facts. Data science and social media can help us make sense of and manipulate the chaos.

item.title: So You Want to Reform Democracy [Medium]
item.description: So You Want to Reform Democracy. Joshua Tauberer. https://medium.com/civic-tech-thoughts-from-joshdata/so-you-want-to-reform-democracy-7f3b1ef10597. Nov 22, 2015. If there was an idea that could ‘fix’ democracy, it would have been thought-up already. If you don't see your idea out there, it’s because it didn’t work the hundreds of other times someone tried it. Let’s tell representatives what their constituents think. Then they HAVE to vote with us! They don’t necessarily want to know what their constituents are thinking.
